channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.K. dads are wrapping baby slings on male statues to push for more paternity leave
item.description: The purpose is to raise awareness on the U.K.'s low paternity leave benefits, which currently stand at two weeks of paid time off for new fathers.
item.content:encoded:
The purpose is to raise awareness on the U.K.'s low paternity leave benefits, which currently stand at two weeks of paid time off for new fathers.

(Image credit: The Dad Shift)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Hazardous chemicals in food packaging can also be found in people
item.description: Chemicals used in food packaging and linked with health problems have been detected in the human body. The chemicals can move from packaging into food.
item.content:encoded:
Chemicals used in food packaging and linked with health problems have been detected in the human body. The chemicals can move from packaging into food.

(Image credit: J Rosello)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: As early voting nears in Georgia, all eyes are on whether young voters will turn out
item.description: Gen Z and millennial voters make up nearly half of the eligible voting population in this year’s election. In Georgia, the race is on to get them registered before early voting begins this month.
item.content:encoded:
Gen Z and millennial voters make up nearly half of the eligible voting population in this year’s election. In Georgia, the race is on to get them registered before early voting begins this month.

(Image credit: Olivia Bowdoin for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: How Biden is getting used to life as a lame duck president
item.description: President Biden has been receding from the spotlight as the campaign marches on. But he still holds the highest office in the land for another four months and he’s is trying to make the most of it.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden has been receding from the spotlight as the campaign marches on. But he still holds the highest office in the land for another four months and he’s is trying to make the most of it.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: The contest in one New Mexico swing district mirrors a larger, anxious electorate
item.description: Democrats and Republicans both think they can win the state's Second Congressional District — one of the swingiest in the country — where immigration and abortion rights are dominating the debate.
item.content:encoded:
Democrats and Republicans both think they can win the state's Second Congressional District — one of the swingiest in the country — where immigration and abortion rights are dominating the debate.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: A rare treat getting rarer: Chimayo Red, New Mexico's 'holy chile'
item.description: A beloved heirloom variety of New Mexico red chile commands high prices because of its scarcity. Finding farmers to continue cultivating it has become a challenge.
item.content:encoded:
A beloved heirloom variety of New Mexico red chile commands high prices because of its scarcity. Finding farmers to continue cultivating it has become a challenge.

(Image credit: John Burnett)
item.dc:creator: John Burnett

item.title: In his hometown, Trump's alleged would-be assassin acted like he was 'above the law'
item.description: Neighbors in Greensboro say Ryan Routh, the man accused of pointing a rifle at the golf course where Donald Trump was playing, wasn't someone they knew well. But he was well-known to law enforcement.
item.content:encoded:
Neighbors in Greensboro say Ryan Routh, the man accused of pointing a rifle at the golf course where Donald Trump was playing, wasn't someone they knew well. But he was well-known to law enforcement.

(Image credit: Tovia Smith)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: Harris says strict abortion laws lead to ‘predictable’ suffering for women
item.description: Speaking in Atlanta Friday, Vice President Harris called tougher abortion laws “immoral” and slammed Republicans for what she called “longstanding neglect” around maternal mortality.
item.content:encoded:
Speaking in Atlanta Friday, Vice President Harris called tougher abortion laws “immoral” and slammed Republicans for what she called “longstanding neglect” around maternal mortality.

(Image credit: Brynn Anderson)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: 30 minutes from Springfield, another Ohio city welcomed immigrants — and got a boost
item.description: Springfield has become a lightning rod in a pitched battle over immigration. Meanwhile, Dayton has welcomed immigrants for more than a decade, to fill vacant jobs and revitalize old neighborhoods.
item.content:encoded: Springfield has become a lightning rod in a pitched battle over immigration. Meanwhile, Dayton has welcomed immigrants for more than a decade, to fill vacant jobs and revitalize old neighborhoods.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Israel's Attacks on Hezbollah in Lebanon Continue
item.description: A building in a residential neighborhood in Beirut was struck by Israel, killing a senior commander with the militant group Hezbollah and ten other fighters, according to the Israeli military. It was the deadliest attack in Beirut in nearly two decades and it comes in the same week Hezbollah militants were targeted by Israel with thousands of exploding pagers and radios. We go to the scene of the strike in Beirut.
item.content:encoded: A building in a residential neighborhood in Beirut was struck by Israel, killing a senior commander with the militant group Hezbollah and ten other fighters, according to the Israeli military. It was the deadliest attack in Beirut in nearly two decades and it comes in the same week Hezbollah militants were targeted by Israel with thousands of exploding pagers and radios. We go to the scene of the strike in Beirut.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf
